intro: Eriocaulon schochianum, commonly known as the Schöch's spike moss, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the family Eriocaulaceae. It is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, white flowers. The plant typically grows in wet, boggy environments, often in the understory of tropical rainforests. It has a short, creeping rhizome with numerous leafy shoots arising from its base. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species, often found in isolated populations in South America.
